hProperties.aria-label: every time you rebuild the plugin you must restart gatsbys development server to reflect the changes in your test environment permalink

children.value: Every time you rebuild the plugin, you must restart Gatsby’s development server to reflect the changes in your test environment.

plugins: [
  {
    resolve: `gatsby-source-graphcms`,
    options: {
      endpoint: `graphql_endpoint`,
      token: `graphql_token`,
      query: `{
          allArtists {
            id
            name
          }
      }`,
    },
  }
],
Gatsby’s data processing layer begins with “source” plugins, configured in
. Here the site sources its data from the GraphCMS endpoint. Use an

file or set environment variables directly to access the GraphCMS
endpoint and token. This avoids committing potentially sensitive data.
Indicates the endpoint to use for the graphql connection
The API access token. Optional if the endpoint is public
The GraphQL query to execute against the endpoint
The Origin header, if required by your endpoint
Let’s say you have a GraphQL type called

. You would query all artists
like so:

{
  allArtists {
    id
    name
    slug
    picture {
      id
      url
      height
      width
    }
    records {
      id
      title
    }
  }
}
If you have a field named
it must be aliased to something else like so:

. This is due to internal limitations of Gatsby’s GraphQL
implementation.

hProperties.aria-label: does not support over 1000 records per __type permalink

children.value: Does not support over 1000 records per
A way to automatically paginate and fetch all data is being worked on, but this is a limitation on the
Graphcool Forum — Query without pagination limits

Limitations Note that a maximum of 1000 nodes can be returned per pagination
field. If you need to query more nodes than that, you can use first and skip
to seek through the different pages. You can also include multiple versions of
the same field with different pagination parameter in one query using GraphQL
Aliases.

hProperties.aria-label: does not support automatic __meta count association permalink

children.value: Does not support automatic __meta count association

Related to pagination and 1K limitation, if you want to show an accurate total count of the result set without wanting to aggregate on the client side, especially with large sets, you might want to use the auto-generated meta fields with
. A way to automatically extract the meta fields from query and use
to add the meta fields to their corresponding nodes is being worked on.

allArticles {
  id
}
__allArticlesMeta {
  count
}
(as we don’t need nor want any nodes from meta fields) and then query the total articles count like so in the page level:
instead because Gatsby tries to create nodes out of top level fields which does not make sense in this case, bearing in mind pagination limitations described above.
, which provides an interesting challenge for the plugin. Work in Gatsby on “
” is ongoing with some really nice
extras for those who host with Netlify
All of the aforementioned limitations are under active discussion and development in the Gatsby channel on the GraphCMS Slack group.
